titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Woodstock Chamber of Commerce Collection, 1922-2015
titlestmt.subtitle: Woodstock Chamber of Commerce Collection 2018-0001

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using a form and manually entry 2020-11-30

titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Shenandoah County Library 2018-0001

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Woodstock Chamber of Commerce Collection, 1922-2015
did.langmaterial: Materials in this collection are in English.
did.abstract: Records of the Woodstock Chamber of Commerce. Includes legal documents, financial records, meeting minutes, photographs, scrapbooks, and membership records. The documents encompass the history of the chamber from its founding in 1922 through its reorganization as the Shenandoah County Chamber of Commerce in 2011.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open to researchers without restrictions. Researchers must register and agree to all copyright laws and archives policies before using the collection. Please contact the Shenandoah County Library before visiting to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: This collection is open to researchers without restrictions. Researchers must registerand agree to all copyright laws and archives policies before using the collection. Pleasecontact the Shenandoah County Library before visiting to use this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: >[Identification of item] Woodstock Chamber of Commerce Collection, 1922-2015, Truban Archives, Shenandoah County Library, Edinburg, Virginia, USA.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Shenandoah County Chamber of Commerce, March 2018. Originally stored in the Chamber attic.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection is contained in sixteen boxes including six full size letter, one half size letter, six small photograph boxes, one small photo slide box, and two large ledger boxes. There are also two oversize folders. During processing much of the original organizational scheme for file names was retained.

bioghist.head: Administrative Information
bioghist.p: The Woodstock Chamber of Commerce was founded in 1922 by a group of local business leaders who sought to improve the local economy. Over the years the organization was responsible for many projects including the construction of the Woodstock Tower, local parades, town beautification efforts, business initiatives, and festivals. The organization merged with several other local chamber of commerce organizations in 2011 and changed its name to the Shenandoah County Chamber of Commerce.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of approximately 16.5 linear feet of materials.

It contains items related to the Woodstock Chamber of Commerce produced between 1922 and 2015. The majority of the items are from the chamber’s membership and board meetings. These include minutes, financial statements, activity reports, and supporting documents.

The collection also contains the chamber’s membership cards for several years ca. 1990. These contain the names of businesses, individuals, and organizations that were members of the chamber and are sorted by membership type.
There is also a small collection of audio and visual materials related to chamber activities.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Woodstock Chamber of Commerce Collection is divided into the following five (5) series:

bibliography.head: Bibliography+
bibliography.p: Woodstock Chamber of Commerce Collection,1922-2015, Truban Archives, Shenandoah County Library, Edinburg, Virginia.
